item.title: We'll be able to hit zombies with meat in singleplayer medieval survival sim God Save Birmingham
item.content:encoded: The King can look after himself.

item.title: The best Smash Bros.-like on Steam just added a character who can shop for items and go fishing in the middle of a match, in case you thought fighting games were too one-note
item.content:encoded: Fin-ish him.

item.title: Five new Steam games you probably missed (February 16, 2026)
item.content:encoded: Sorting through every new game on Steam so you don't have to.

item.title: Solid Snake is coming to Rainbow Six Siege in March with David Hayter reprising the role, and a new trailer shows Snake and stealth game rival Sam Fisher finally squashing the beef
item.content:encoded: New playlists, weapons, map updates, and yes, Solid Snake, await.

item.title: Hideki Sato, father of the Sega Dreamcast, Saturn, Genesis, and more, has died
item.content:encoded: Sato's career in games began in the 1970s.

item.title: Silent Hill 2 Remake dev Bloober Team's Valentine's Day reveal turned out to be Layers of Fear 3
item.content:encoded: Sorry if you were expecting Cronos 2.

item.title: The EU declares TikTok's 'infinite scroll' and 'highly personalised recommender system' are 'addictive design in breach of the Digital Services Act'
item.content:encoded: The European Commission has taken a stance against some of social media's deleterious rhythms.

item.title: Doom co-creator John Romero adores Ghost Recon and has over 3,000 hours in World of Warcraft: 'God, I lived in that game every day for five years'
item.content:encoded: The co-founder of id Software and Romero Games takes us on a tour of his games library.

item.title: The most surprising thing about Mewgenics is its amazing soundtrack—and after 115 hours, I'm still discovering new songs
item.content:encoded: I'm a chumbucket kitty baby living in the city.

item.title: Someone is building a lifesized Seikret cosplay despite the fact they've 'never made anything like this before' and after seeing the process, you can't convince me this thing doesn't live and breathe
item.content:encoded: His name is Zekki, and I love him.

item.title: Absolum's first update dares you to unravel the threads of fate, introducing rule modifiers, corrupted biomes and improved mounts into 2025's best beat 'em up
item.content:encoded: Play new game presets or create your own in Guard Crush Games' stunning slugfest.

item.title: Hellscreen, the FPS with a rear-view mirror, has left Steam early access two episodes short of its original plan: 'This is a bittersweet experience for me'
item.content:encoded: The Doom-like shooter was unable to realise its final form due to "budget reasons."

item.title: Seafaring survival sim The Last Caretaker gets a big update that adds a speedy jet ski and lets you customise your base-boat
item.content:encoded: Also adds new quests, locations and a sonar module.

item.title: Unreal Tournament 2004 is now available for free thanks to its fan community, and they've even updated the game for modern PCs: 'This is the first public patch for Unreal Tournament 2004 in over 20 years'
item.content:encoded: Wicked sick.

item.title: As the Legacy of Kain remasters continue, a new game emerges—a 2D action-platformer
item.content:encoded: Legacy of Kain: Ascendance and Legacy of Kain: Defiance Remastered will both be available in March.

item.title: Divinity: Original Sin 2 easter eggs hinting Baldur's Gate 3 would be Larian's next game had to be toned down: 'Originally the reference to BG3 was very explicit'
item.content:encoded: Does this mean there are hints in Baldur's Gate 3 about what'll be in Divinity?

item.title: 'We lost things such as physics in games:' The dev behind my most anticipated RPG thinks players are craving more interactive games, not just 'moving around in a static 3D environment'
item.content:encoded: Well, I am, anyway.

item.title: 'They can never kill emulation': Players vexed as Nintendo continues its siege on Switch emulation, handing DMCAs to various emulators on GitHub
item.content:encoded: It might be time to back up some files.

item.title: The dev behind my top upcoming RPG is a Hungarian chef who thought 'if not now, then when?' and learned coding from scratch to make his dream 'eurojank' masterpiece
item.content:encoded: "People have been craving this sort of experience, which was offered by Larian and CD Projekt."

item.title: That new Metal Gear Solid collection won't include Metal Gear Online, but it will have Peace Walker's essential online co-op
item.content:encoded: Konami giveth, and Konami taketh away.

item.title: Mewgenics provides the best proof yet that the turn-based tactics genre is the true home of drama and excitement in gaming
item.content:encoded: Treat me mean, keep me keen.

item.title: Inside PC gaming's wildly creative Tomb Raider mapping scene: 'Being able to create my own adventures for other people to play is such an addicting concept'
item.content:encoded: Tomb Raider has a fan-level scene as storied as Quake or Thief.

item.title: The Overwatch dating sim and its associated rewards are back for a limited time, but it's still got far fewer romances than its China-exclusive counterpart
item.content:encoded: Sorry if you were hoping to woo Junker Queen or Mauga.

item.title: Question time: What role—tank, healer, or DPS—do you actually play in MMORPGS, and why?
item.content:encoded: Party finder.

item.title: Can you guess which videogame these potions are from?
item.content:encoded: A cure for all that ails.

item.title: Digging a little deeper into Intel's Xe3 architecture shows exactly why Panther Lake's iGPU is good: It's basically an Arc A770 graphics card jammed into a mobile chip
item.content:encoded: And with better DRAM, it would absolutely fly.

item.title: Underrated hack 'n' slash Blades of Fire heads to Steam with a 2.0 update, bringing new game plus and 'expanded death and mutilation variations' for you sickos out there
item.content:encoded: It's me. I'm the sicko.

item.title: THQ's Gothic 1 remake arrives in June, and I think it might prove a more valuable overhaul than Oblivion Remastered
item.content:encoded: The great grandaddy of eurojank looks spiffing in its latest trailer.

item.title: Which PC gaming icon is your soulmate this Valentine's Day?
item.content:encoded: Love is in the air.

item.title: Bloodlines 2's Valentine's patch adds further customisation options and lootable blood bags, because nothing says 'I love you' like the vampire equivalent of a ready meal
item.content:encoded: Love bite.

item.title: Final Fantasy 14's Valentine's Day event is a Mario Party-lite encounter that reminded me it's actually quite fun to do some socializing in an MMO
item.content:encoded: I am become Cake Boss.

item.title: This horror sim is like running a food truck in Fallout: cook questionable meals for mutants, monsters, and the occasional alien
item.content:encoded: There are a lot of hungry mouths to feed in the wasteland. Some of them are even on faces.

item.title: High on Life 2 review
item.content:encoded: A creative, funny, and surprisingly chill adventure with nagging problems.

item.title: Oh, good: Discord's age verification rollout has ties to Palantir co-founder and panopticon architect Peter Thiel
item.content:encoded: Discord is "experimenting" with an age authentication vendor whose major investors include Thiel's Founders Fund.

item.title: Microsoft AI CEO curiously omits 'Microsoft AI CEO' from list of white collar jobs that will be replaceable by AI in next 18 months
item.content:encoded: I'm sure there's a good reason for the omission.

item.title: Three years after its last update, the original Kingdom Come: Deliverance gets a new patch that includes a new caparison for your horse
item.content:encoded: Don't worry if you don't know what a caparison is: I looked it up so you don't have to.

item.title: Sandfall Interactive continues its Larian-like ways as Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 wins Game of the Year and four other trophies at the DICE Awards
item.content:encoded: Other big winners at this year's event include Ghost of Yotei, Death Stranding 2, and Blue Prince.

item.title: Tumbler Ridge mass murderer once created a mass shooting game in Roblox
item.content:encoded: Roblox says it has terminated the account belonging to Tumbler Ridge shooter Jesse Van Rootselaar, and deleted the game.

item.title: Brace for more Belmont: Konami says Castlevania: Belmont's Curse is just 'the beginning of numerous new products around Castlevania'
item.content:encoded: What a wonderful night to have a curse!

item.title: Mewgenics co-creator Edmund McMillen says 'people need to get more creative with their hate' in response to disappointment over controversial cameo meows
item.content:encoded: "I understand we live in a time where a meow from someone who has different beliefs as you is scary and frustrating, confusing and controversial."

item.title: Nutmeg is a brilliant concept that at its best is almost football Balatro, but boy is this a game of two halves
item.content:encoded: A dream game with some nightmare trappings.

item.title: A fraction of the most popular PC games over the past year use hardware-level ray tracing, which is far fewer than I'd predict just 24 months ago
item.content:encoded: That's five of the 21 most popular games.

item.title: Nvidia's game streaming app GeForce Now touches down on Amazon Fire TV devices—yes, even the little dongles
item.content:encoded: Plug and play.

item.title: Fight At Midnight
item.content:encoded: Xal'atath schemes in the shadows - Azeroth prepares for battle. When the clock chimes – will you be ready to fight?

item.title: HyperX FlipCast gaming microphone review
item.content:encoded: Pretty good, but the price gives me serious pause.

item.title: Yakuza Kiwami 3 spoils an interesting remake with odd changes and an abysmally misjudged recast
item.content:encoded: I've been playing both the original and the remake simultaneously, because I have no respect for the limited time I have left on this Earth.

item.title: You can pick up $1000+-worth of Fallout tabletop gubbins for $25 right now, with a portion going to the ACLU
item.content:encoded: That's a lot of gubbins.

item.title: Den of Wolves studio 10 Chambers announces 'significant restructuring' and layoffs, 'including several of the studio’s co-founders'
item.content:encoded: 10 Chambers says the remaining team is "fully committed" to Den of Wolves.

item.title: Hurry, you have less than 1 week to move to Norway and have a baby with someone: 'Lie together today, get GTA 6 free from us in 9 months'
item.content:encoded: Note: Do not actually do this.

item.title: Behind the curtain of mouse development: from hand-carving to mechanical flinging, here's how Logitech makes and tests its gaming mice
item.content:encoded: A nice mix of mechanical accuracy with a human touch.
